title: A Brief History of Time
author: Stephen Hawking
description: Stephen Hawking's landmark volume explores profound questions about the universe, from the Big Bang to black holes, in accessible language.

title: Becoming
author: Michelle Obama
description: In her memoir, Michelle Obama chronicles the experiences that have shaped her—from her childhood to her role as First Lady of the United States.

title: Blink
author: Malcolm Gladwell
description: Malcolm Gladwell explores the power of 'thin-slicing'—our ability to make quick decisions with minimal information.

title: Counting the Cost
author: Jill Duggar
description: Jill Duggar shares her personal journey of faith, family, and finding her own path beyond the expectations of her upbringing.

title: How To Keep House While Drowning
author: KC Davis, LPC
description: KC Davis offers a compassionate guide to managing household tasks for those struggling with mental health, burnout, or executive dysfunction.

title: I'm Glad My Mom Died
author: Jennette McCurdy
description: In this memoir, Jennette McCurdy recounts her experiences as a child actor and her complex relationship with her mother.

title: I Am Malala
author: Malala Yousafzai
description: Malala Yousafzai's inspiring story of standing up for education and being targeted by the Taliban.

title: Invisible Women
author: Caroline Criado Perez
description: Caroline Criado Perez exposes the gender data gap and its impact on women's lives.

title: Killers of the Flower Moon
author: David Grann
description: David Grann investigates the Osage murders and the birth of the FBI in this gripping true-crime narrative.

title: Night
author: Elie Wiesel
description: Elie Wiesel's haunting memoir of his experiences in Nazi concentration camps during the Holocaust.

title: The Anthropocene Reviewed
author: John Green
description: John Green reviews facets of the human-centered planet with insight and humor in this collection of essays.

title: The Anxious Generation
author: Jonathan Haidt
description: Jonathan Haidt explores the rise of anxiety among youth in the digital age and offers solutions for a healthier future.

title: The Art of War
author: Sun Tzu
description: An ancient Chinese military treatise attributed to Sun Tzu, offering timeless strategies on warfare and leadership.

title: Atomic Habits
author: James Clear
description: James Clear presents a proven framework for building good habits and breaking bad ones, emphasizing the power of tiny changes.

title: The Diary of a Young Girl
author: Anne Frank
description: The poignant diary entries of Anne Frank, a Jewish teenager hiding during the Nazi occupation of the Netherlands.

title: The Tipping Point
author: Malcolm Gladwell
description: Malcolm Gladwell explores how small actions at the right time, in the right place, and with the right people can create a tipping point for a trend or idea.

title: The Wager
author: David Grann
description: David Grann recounts the harrowing tale of the HMS Wager, a British ship wrecked in the 18th century, leading to mutiny and survival against the odds.

title: What If?
author: Randall Munroe
description: Randall Munroe provides serious scientific answers to absurd hypothetical questions, blending humor with physics and science.

title: When Breath Becomes Air
author: Paul Kalanithi
description: Neurosurgeon Paul Kalanithi reflects on his life and mortality after being diagnosed with terminal cancer, offering insights into the meaning of life.

title: A Flicker in the Dark
author: Stacy Willingham
description: A gripping debut about a psychologist whose past comes back to haunt her when teenage girls start disappearing in her town.

title: A Good Girl's Guide to Murder
author: Holly Jackson
description: A high school student investigates a closed murder case for her project, uncovering secrets that someone wants to stay buried.

title: And Then There Were None
author: Agatha Christie
description: Ten strangers are invited to a secluded island, where they are accused of crimes and start dying one by one.

title: Angels and Demons
author: Dan Brown
description: Harvard symbologist Robert Langdon uncovers a deadly vendetta against the Catholic Church by the secretive Illuminati.

title: Behind Closed Doors
author: B.A. Paris
description: A seemingly perfect marriage hides dark secrets in this chilling psychological thriller.

title: Dark Matter
author: Blake Crouch
description: A mind-bending thriller about a man who is abducted into a world where his life has taken a different path.

title: Dark Places
author: Gillian Flynn
description: Libby Day, the sole survivor of her family's massacre, revisits the crime years later to uncover the truth.

title: Gone Girl
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A marriage gone terribly wrong, leading to a media frenzy and a series of shocking revelations.

title: Inferno
author: Dan Brown
description: Robert Langdon wakes up in an Italian hospital with amnesia and must follow a trail of clues tied to Dante's Inferno.

title: None of This Is True
author: Lisa Jewell
description: A podcaster's chance encounter with a mysterious woman leads to a chilling tale of secrets and lies.

title: One of Us Is Lying
author: Karen M. McManus
description: Five students walk into detention, but only four come out alive. Everyone is a suspect, and everyone has something to hide.

title: Rock Paper Scissors
author: Alice Feeney
description: A couple's weekend getaway to a remote Scottish chapel reveals secrets that could destroy their marriage.

title: Sharp Objects
author: Gillian Flynn
description: A journalist returns to her hometown to cover the murder of two young girls, confronting her own traumatic past.

title: The Girl on the Train
author: Paula Hawkins
description: A psychological thriller that delves into the complexities of memory and perception as a woman becomes entangled in a missing person's investigation.

title: The Girl Who Kicked the Hornet's Nest
author: Stieg Larsson
description: The final installment in the Millennium series, where Lisbeth Salander confronts her past and seeks justice against those who have wronged her.

title: The Girl Who Played With Fire
author: Stieg Larsson
description: Lisbeth Salander becomes the prime suspect in a double murder, leading her to uncover a web of corruption and secrets.

title: The Girl With the Dragon Tattoo
author: Stieg Larsson
description: A journalist and a hacker team up to solve a decades-old disappearance, uncovering dark family secrets along the way.

title: The Housemaid
author: Freida McFadden
description: A woman takes a job as a live-in housemaid, only to discover that the family's secrets are more dangerous than she imagined.

title: The Housemaid's Secret
author: Freida McFadden
description: The sequel to 'The Housemaid' continues the gripping tale of deception and survival as secrets threaten to unravel.

title: The Lost Symbol
author: Dan Brown
description: Robert Langdon uncovers a hidden history and a secret society while racing against time to save a kidnapped friend.

title: Then She Was Gone
author: Lisa Jewell
description: A mother's search for her missing daughter leads to shocking revelations in this gripping psychological thriller.

title: The Only One Left
author: Riley Sager
description: A caregiver uncovers dark secrets in a decaying mansion while tending to a woman accused of a decades-old murder.

title: The Paris Apartment
author: Lucy Foley
description: A woman searching for her missing brother in Paris discovers that his neighbors harbor dangerous secrets.

title: The Silent Patient
author: Alex Michaelides
description: A psychotherapist becomes obsessed with uncovering the truth behind a patient's silence after she commits a shocking act of violence.

title: The Woman in the Window
author: A.J. Finn
description: An agoraphobic woman believes she has witnessed a crime in her neighbor's house, but her reality is questioned as secrets unravel.

title: Verity
author: Colleen Hoover
description: A struggling writer is hired to complete an injured author's series, only to uncover a chilling manuscript that reveals disturbing truths.

title: A Curse for True Love
author: Stephanie Garber
description: The final book in the 'Once Upon a Broken Heart' trilogy, where Evangeline Fox faces the ultimate test of true love amidst curses and dark magic.

title: Assistant to the Villain
author: Hannah Nicole Maehrer
description: A humorous fantasy where a young woman becomes the assistant to a notorious villain, navigating office politics and dark deeds.

title: Fairy Tale
author: Stephen King
description: A seventeen-year-old boy inherits the keys to a parallel world where good and evil are at war, and the stakes could not be higher.

title: Heartless Hunter
author: Kristen Ciccarelli
description: In a world where witches are hunted, a young woman must hide her true identity while navigating a dangerous romance.

title: How the King of Elfhame Learned to Hate Stories
author: Holly Black
publisher: Little, Brown Books for Young Readers
description: A collection of stories revealing the dark past of Elfhame's king, offering insights into his complex character.

title: Legendborn
author: Tracy Deonn
description: A modern-day twist on Arthurian legend, where a young woman discovers a secret society and her own magical heritage.

title: Once Upon a Broken Heart
author: Stephanie Garber
description: Evangeline Fox believes in true love and happy endings, but when her dreams are shattered, she makes a deal with the Prince of Hearts.

title: The Adventures of Amina Al-Sirafi
author: Shannon Chakraborty
description: A retired pirate is drawn back into the high seas for one last adventure involving forbidden artifacts and ancient mysteries.

title: The Atlas Six
author: Olivie Blake
description: Six talented magicians are invited to join a secret society, but only five will survive the initiation.

title: The Ballad of Never After
author: Stephanie Garber
description: Evangeline Fox continues her journey, facing new challenges and darker magic in the sequel to 'Once Upon a Broken Heart'.

title: The Ballad of Songbirds and Snakes
author: Suzanne Collins
description: A prequel to The Hunger Games trilogy, this novel follows a young Coriolanus Snow as he mentors a tribute in the 10th Hunger Games, exploring themes of ambition, power, and morality.

title: The Eye of the Bedlam Bride
author: Matt Dinniman
description: The sixth installment in the Dungeon Crawler Carl series, where Carl and Princess Donut navigate the chaotic eighth floor of the dungeon, facing new challenges and adversaries.

title: The Midnight Library
author: Matt Haig
description: A novel exploring the choices that go into a life well lived, as protagonist Nora Seed finds herself in a library between life and death, with books representing different paths her life could have taken.

title: The Sunlit Man
author: Brandon Sanderson
description: Set in the Cosmere universe, this standalone novel follows Nomad as he flees the Night Brigade, landing on the planet Canticle, where he must navigate a world where sunlight is deadly.

title: Tress of the Emerald Sea
author: Brandon Sanderson
description: A whimsical adventure in the Cosmere universe, where Tress embarks on a journey across the Emerald Sea to rescue her love, encountering pirates, dragons, and magic along the way.

title: Yumi and the Nightmare Painter
author: Brandon Sanderson
description: In this Cosmere novel, Yumi, a spirit summoner, and Nikaro, a nightmare painter, find their lives intertwined as they confront a world filled with darkness and dreams.
